intro: Lachenalia declinata, commonly known as the leaning lachenalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming structure. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and succulent collections.
